techmeme.title: Google says it plans to use QR codes for Gmail account authentication, ditching SMS to "reduce the impact of rampant, global SMS abuse" (Davey Winder/Forbes)
TD Cowen: Microsoft cancels leases for a substantial amount of US data centers, potentially due to over-investment fears; Microsoft plans to spend $80B in 2025 (Bloomberg)
An analysis of the $1.46B Bybit hack, by far the largest crypto heist of all time, ahead of Poly Network's $611M in 2021, and possibly the biggest theft ever (Elliptic)
Apple says it will spend $500B in the US over the next four years, hire 20,000 new US workers, and produce AI servers in Texas, after Tim Cook met with Trump (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
Some hair stylists, bridal shops, and hardware stores say AI generated "inspo", taken from platforms like Pinterest, is warping customers' sense of reality (Tatum Hunter/Washington Post)
